Topic.Title: president obama's accomplishments

Message.Msg: fariba, Thank you! Thank you for helping elevate the TRUTH....so it rises to the surface. It is VERY unfortunate that Owe-Bama was NEVER VETTED by the media. The media has MISERABLY FAILED the American People. And - NOW - many people feel that buyer's remorse feeling after being sucked into the "hope & change" dream - which had ZERO SUBSTANCE behind it. I imagine most people were SHOCKED at getting to know the REAL Mitt Romney at the Republican National Convention. For months, the media just spewed out all kinds of blatant lie$, rumor$ and mi$leading information about BAIN CAPITAL - which has created over 100,000 jobs - still in existence today !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Celebrating American entrepreneurial success is something that escapes the Radical $ocialist movement which has hijacked the media. Here are the FACTS about Mitt Romney at BAIN CAPITAL and his other accomplishments that have gone UNREPORTED by the media (copied from the Romney website): Governor Romney's work at Bain Capital was about fixing companies that were broken and giving new companies a shot at success. Building Businesses, Creating Jobs Governor Romney's time at Bain Capital was spent fixing struggling businesses and giving new businesses a shot at success. From 1984, when Romney co-founded the firm, to February 1999 when he left to lead the Olympics, Romney helped save thousands of jobs at companies that were in trouble. And the businesses Romney helped start while at Bain Capital employ more than 100,000 people today. Since Bain Capital's founding, the company has had a remarkable record of success, especially considering that it largely invests with struggling or startup enterprises. Eighty percent of Bain Capital's portfolio companies have increased revenues, and only five percent of the companies under its control have filed for bankruptcy. Romney's work not only helped to save and create jobs, it also provided returns to investors, the majority of which were pension funds for retirees, university endowments helping with financial aid, and charities serving their local communities. This experience helped Romney fix a scandal-plagued and debt-ridden Olympics in 2002 and to fix a budget shortfall in Massachusetts. He knows how to provide strong leadership in challenging times, and he will bring that experience with him to the White House to fix America's broken economy and to create jobs for the millions of Americans who are out of work. The Obama campaign's attacks on business and free enterprise aren't just false; they explain why we aren't creating jobs. They reveal what this President really thinks about free enterprise. This is the most anti-business President in memory, and the results are clear: 23 million Americans are struggling for work, and unemployment has been above eight percent for 42 straight months. It's time to make a change to someone who understands the private sector and can get America working again.

Message.Msg: Biggest mistake AAPL investors make is believing that the relatively low PE and earning growth is reason to believe the stock will keep going up. The problem with this simplistic view is that the market cap is too large to sustain future growth and the margins will simply have to come down to maintain these levels of sales. So focus on the market cap and the potential size of the market and you will realize why AAPL can not maintain a 600 B valuation unless you believe every man, woman and child across the world will be standing in line for a new iphone 5.

What I think we should all be focused on is the next earnings. Last earnings, Apple guided lower which resulted in a sell off. Topic.Title: Dem leaders rely on other dems to be as stupid as themselves

Message.Msg: Obama: I have found that most people against Obamacare don't understand how our present system of health insurance works. Our present health insurance evolved during World War II as an employee benefit to skirt around price and wage controls then in effect. Back then, if you got cancer, you went home and died. Today, you go home broke and sell your home, even with employer provided health insurance. Employer provided Heath insurance does not protect Americans from an economic catastrophy because the policy is owned by the employer, not the employee. Also today companies must compete on a global basis. American companies will lose against countries that have no health insurance every time. Obamacare is an attempt at private Heath insurance to correct some of these deficiencies It is less socialized than what we have now (half the beds in hospitals are occupied by people without health insurance and can not afford to pay).

Message.Msg: The P&F Chart Price Target for XOM is $105.00 (3rd Party Technical Analysis -- used by MANY professional traders and investors). XOM is conservatively and very well-managed and is one of the Top Brands in the World. I know the company well. Since Feb. 2011, XOM has been consolidating - banging up against the resistance level of $88ish. When it breaks it clearly, then I see a run to $96ish. In the Long-term, the technicals point to a move up to $120ish. When a clear break is made of resistance at $88ish, then I believe the P&F Target will update to reflect a Price Target closer to $120ish. From a macro-economic perspective, XOM has benefited from both up & down commodity cycles for many decades. Take a look at the LONG-TERM CHART. Low Nat-Gas prices are feedstock for the growing Ethylene chemical business - which XOM is expanding. If Exxon's Chemcial Business were to be "spun-off", then it would be the largest Chemical Company in the USA. Read this recent news release on the expanding Ethylene Plant - to take advantage of lower Nat-Gas costs... Bloomberg News Exxon Plans U.S. Ethylene Plant to Make Use of Cheap Gas June 01, 2012 Exxon Mobil Corp. (XOM), the largest U.S. oil company, plans to build factories that produce ethylene and plastics in Texas, joining a growing group of competitors racing to use U.S. natural gas to make chemicals. A new plant at the company’s site in Baytown would produce 1.5 million metric tons of ethylene annually starting in 2016, pending regulatory approvals, Irving, Texas-based Exxon said today in an e-mailed statement. The gaseous chemical would be used to make 1.3 million metric tons of polyethylene plastic at two plants to be built in nearby Mont Belvieu, the company said. The Houston-area plants would “significantly” increase exports of plastics, Exxon said in the statement. Chevron Phillips Chemical Co. is planning a $5 billion ethylene project at its Baytown site and Dow Chemical Co. (DOW) is also expanding to use more gas-based raw materials that provide a cost advantage over oil-based production in Europe and Asia. “The proposed investment reflects Exxon Mobil’s continued confidence in the natural-gas-driven revitalization of the U.S. chemical industry,” the company said in the statement. Gas prices in New York fell to a 10-year-low in April and have pushed costs for U.S. chemical producers to the lowest outside of the Middle East, Cynthia Werneth, an analyst at Standard & Poor’s, said on a conference call today. Exxon’s Largest The ethylene plant would be Exxon’s largest in the U.S. and its first in the country since 1997. The company has two ethylene plants in Baytown with capacities of 1 million tons and 1.2 million tons; a 800,000-ton capacity factory in Beaumont, Texas; and 1-million-ton plant in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, according to Exxon’s 2011 Financial & Operating Review. The polyethylene plants would increase by 34 percent Exxon’s U.S. output of the resin used to make products such as food packaging and plastics bags, based on data in the company review. Globally, Exxon’s ethylene capacity would increase 17 percent and its polyethylene production would rise 18 percent. The project would create 10,000 construction jobs and would boost Exxon’s Baytown workforce of 6,500 by about 350, the company said. Margaret Ross, a company spokeswoman, declined to say in a telephone interview how much the project would cost.

Topic.Title: Got an app idea that will get at least 20 million downloads. Should I write it for Android or Apple?

Message.Msg: When I said structured, I mean in a designing it in way that takes to heart the principles of object oriented programming like understanding classes, methods, objects, etc. Not to be confused with structured programming, a concept that was around 30 years ago, lol. Just google "porting objective c to java" or visa versa and there is a wealth of information (and tools) available for porting (believe it or not, you are not the first person to do this, lol). The syntax is slightly different ... example: [ myEditingContext insertObject: newCustomer ] ; in objective C becomes myEditingContext.insertObject(newCustomer) ; in java ..., but much of it is straightforward if you design and code it correctly. Good luck!

Topic.Title: Shorts - Comedy please - How much and how fast do you think AAPL will go down?

Message.Msg: I am not a short, I have been a long since 80 but 5 or 6 times I have liquidated all my stock and options, the last time was before earnings and bought back the day after picking up an additional $30 per share and making a good deal on the options. I have done this again this week as I believe it will be hard for the Sept 12th to live up to the hype that has already been given. I don't think there will be as much as some expect and therefore a temporary pullback, this in part was exposed last week when Sharp said they couldn't deliver on the glass panels that were due 8/1 and wasn't sure when they could, I realize they are just one of 3 suppliers but it is a problem and will cut deeply into sales. I expect more news of that order, AAPL wants to get away from Samsung as a supplier but is having trouble finding a replacement, that is another hiccup. The positive is they are discussing with GOOG. I will get back in after I see the reaction to the sept 12 product announcement. I am expecting a dip to 630 area. Downside risk after a 100 point run up is higher than upside, I don't mind missing a little up side but the big down side I will try to miss. Time for a small correction IMO. Also the market is ready for a correction, the big boys need to shake a few trees before this can go up more. Then there is the typical worst month of the year for the market. Everything seems to be pointing as a time to be on sideline and currently i am in 50% cash.

Message.Title: wow... apple added galaxy s iii and galaxy note to the patents infringement list. very bed for the kopiest
Message.Msg: Apple on Friday filed an amended complaint with the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California, adding two versions each of the Galaxy S III and Galaxy Note to its original claims of patent infringement against a number of Samsung smartphones and tablets. The case, not to be confused with the recently decided Apple v. Samsung trial, was first lodged in February, with Apple leveraging eight utility patents against 17 Samsung devices. At the time, it was said that Apple was taking direct aim at the Samsung-built Google-branded Galaxy Nexus with the complaint. Along with the Galaxy S III and the Verizon version of the handset, Apple added the Galaxy Note and Galaxy Note 10.1 to the list of infringing devices, bringing the total tally up to 21 accused devices. The S III made its U.S. debut in June, more than one year after Apple lodged its first complaint against Samsung in April 2011, accusing the company's products of copying the look and feel of the iPhone and iPad. Apple claims it is suffering and will suffer irreparable harm from Samsung's violation of eight utility patents, four being asserted in the Apple v. Samsung case and four issued after that suit began. According to Apple, Samsung has "continued to flood the market with copycat products," since the separate landmark case started last year. In the intervening months, the Korean company has "continued to release new infringing products, including its current flagship device, the Galaxy S III."
